title: Hemtabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Hemtabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Uttar%20Dinajpur%20district">Uttar Dinajpur district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. It came into existence in 2011, as per orders of the Delimitation Commission. The seat is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 33 Hemtabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) (SC) covers <a href="Hemtabad%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Hemtabad</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a> and Bhatol, Bindol, Jagadishpur, Mahipur, Sherpur, Rampur and Sitgram <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Raiganj%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Raiganj</a> community development block.
Hemtabad (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of No. 5 <a href="Raiganj%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Raiganj (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
2021.
In the 2021 election, Satyajit Barman of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival, Chandima Roy of BJP.
2016.
In the 2016 election, <a href="Debendra%20Nath%20Roy">Debendra Nath Roy</a> of CPI(M) defeated Sabita Kshetry of Trinamool Congress.
Note- Later in 2019 <a href="Debendra%20Nath%20Roy">Debendra Nath Roy</a> joined <a href="Bharatiya%20Janata%20Party">BJP</a>.
2011.
In the 2011 election, Khagendra Nath Sinha of CPI(M) defeated Sekhar Chandra Roy of Trinamool Congress.
 
The Raiganj MP, <a href="Deepa%20Dasmunsi">Deepa Dasmunsi</a>, campaigned for the rebel Congress candidate contesting from Hemtabad as an independent candidate, Chittaranjan Roy, who was suspended from the Congress Party.
